key_points: South Lake High School in St. Clair Shores was evacuated due to a bomb threat.
The bomb threat was reported around 11:30 a.m. and led to a heavy police and emergency response.
Families were seen reuniting with students as they were evacuated from the school grounds.
Authorities used canine units to search the school but found no devices.
The investigation into the source of the threat is ongoing.
This incident follows a recent school shooting in Oxford High School, Michigan, causing widespread concern.
Several schools across southeast Michigan closed due to threats of violence, partly influenced by the Oxford High School shooting.
The FBI is aware of the threats to area schools and is coordinating responses with local law enforcement.
Arrests related to school threats were made in Southfield and Sterling Heights.
Some school districts increased safety measures without closing, while others closed for the day or longer.
